html:
** Shares of telecoms group Airtel Africa AAF.L down as much as 15.8% at 130.5p; top loser on the FTSE 100 .FTSE

** Funds managed by Warburg Pincus LLC and Morningstar Investment sold 58 mln existing shares in AAF, representing about 1.5% of co's issued share capital (Full Story)

** Gross sale proceeds from placing offering amounted to 81.2 mln pounds ($109.85 mln), equal to 140p for each ordinary share

** Pricing represents a discount of 9.7% to stock's Monday closing at 155p

** AAF set to post worst day since December 2020; hits lowest level since December 2021

** AAF was inducted to the FTSE 100 on Jan. 31 from the mid-cap index .FTMC

** Stock surged ~77% in 2021


($1 = 0.7392 pounds)


(Reporting by Amna Karimi in Bengaluru)

(( amna.karimi@thomsonreuters.com ))
